highlight.name: 93cc5a65-6f78-aa35-9b0f-ead7bae183b0
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: programmer creates with an editor and saves in a text ﬁle called hello.c.

highlight.name: 22c7ee81-6cd1-9430-5cee-b2f3618fb1d3
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: The source program is a sequence of bits, each with a value of 0 or 1, organized in 8-bit chunks called bytes.

highlight.name: 57f89ad9-2df6-5a3e-c11a-cad2647d49a0
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Each byte represents some text character in the program.

highlight.name: a1832d17-219c-be79-f551-f12b8d22e102
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Most computer systems represent text characters using the ASCII standard that represents each character with a unique byte-size integer value.

highlight.name: a8470845-7f89-562d-1e23-84f5d48863fb
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: The hello.c program is stored in a ﬁle as a sequence of bytes.

highlight.name: 67f6365b-2d92-c5fb-f761-09ba4236f1cb
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Files such as hello.c that consist exclusively of ASCII characters are known as text ﬁles. All other ﬁles are known as binary ﬁles.

highlight.name: 6a6b6e5c-4389-89d9-3462-91e8d6e4574f
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: All information in a system—including disk ﬁles, programs stored in memory, user data stored in memory, and data transferred across a network—is represented as a bunch of bits.

highlight.name: 027bb5cf-8073-8f8f-ea98-fc37dbec629c
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: in different contexts, the same sequence of bytes might represent an integer, ﬂoating-point number, character string, or machine instruction.
